sentences.english: The four-letter words were always edited out of radio scripts until quite recently.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近廣播稿中的庸俗詞語才讓保留下來。

sentences.english: The greed, discrimination and vulgarism are not souls.
sentences.chinese: 貪婪，歧視和庸俗沒有靈魂。

sentences.english: It was just his vulgar way of showing off.
sentences.chinese: 那樣子就像歌唱演員表演似的，完全是庸俗的炫耀。

sentences.english: They have vulgarized many of the loveliest spots in our country.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我國許多最美的旅遊勝地弄得庸俗不堪。

sentences.english: After three days without reading, talk becomes flavorless .
sentences.chinese: 三天不讀書，談話顯庸俗。

sentences.english: "They tended to think it was vulgar and sexually provocative, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “他們往往認爲這是庸俗的性挑逗，”他說。

sentences.english: LORD GORING . Just as vulgarity is simply the conduct of other people.
sentences.chinese: 戈林子爵正像庸俗只是別人的行爲一樣。

sentences.english: This is a one-man show of paintings whose theme was the vulgarity of modern life.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個以現代生活的庸俗爲主題的個人畫展。

sentences.english: Minister hits at 'vulgarity' in culture sector.
sentences.chinese: 文化部部長蔡武抨擊庸俗文化亂象。

sentences.english: Many people find this sort of joke distasteful.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲這種笑話是低級庸俗的。

sentences.english: That even its grossest flatterers dare not praise.
sentences.chinese: 最庸俗的馬屁精也未敢討好。

sentences.english: Gerald was nettled by this implication of vulgar materialism.
sentences.chinese: 傑拉德被她話語中流露出的庸俗唯物主義惹惱了。

sentences.english: Four: This is a four-letter story.
This is a humble conclusion, but I cannot make myself disbelieve it.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很庸俗的結論，然而我無法使自己懷疑它。

definition: to cater to the public's taste/kitsch/commercial
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
